snippet: The new chief of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, received a one-time stock award worth nearly $400 million, the largest given by a company in a decade. The award was mean to signal the board's confidence in him as the successor to Steven P. Jobs.
abstract: The new chief of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, received a one-time stock award worth nearly $400 million, the largest given by a company in a decade. The award was mean to signal the board's confidence in him as the successor to Steven P. Jobs.

headline.main: Apple's New Chief Gets Big Stock Award
